title.narrative: 604 ENSURE PROVISION OF SOCIAL PROTECTION MITIGATE IMPACT& REDUCE ECO VULNERABILI

description.narrative: Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide and ensure provision of social protection to children, adolescents, caregivers and vulnerable families to meet their essential needs to mitigate impact and/or reducing economic vulnerabilities., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social policies and strategies inform more effective and efficient planning, budgeting and implementation of social service programmes for reducing inequities and gender inequalities especially for the most vulnerable and marginalized children and adolescents by 2022

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide and ensure provision of social protection to children, adolescents,caregivers and vulnerable families to meet their essential needs to mitigate impact and/or reducing economic vulnerabilities.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s evidence-based advocacy and technical assistance led to new cash transfers for children orphaned during COVID-19 reaching 7661 children with plus services addressing trauma through 240 UNICEF trained counsellors; across nine states, capacity building of 63,696 local governments, 5000 CBOs and 1.8 million women SHGs to deliver emergency social protection services; across multiple states; reaching 449,912 vulnerable households to access emergency government assistance; in four states and nationally, informing social protection delivery scaleups, expansion of social services workforce, risk informed child sensitive financing, portable social protection for migrants; and safeguarded budgets for children with increased allocations of 162 million USD. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of states which introduced flexibility in social protection schemes post the COVID-19 pandemic to increase the coverage and tackle vulnerabilities, both in demand and supply side, with UNICEF support(70306), Number
